page.title: 02Farming around Aston Clinton
page.content:
Most farms today are a mixture between crop and livestock. Around Aston Clinton there are quite a few farms. Most of them are a mixture but there are also two dairy farms. Most farms also have a lot of machinery for harvesting, sowing seeds, and spraying to make them grow more quickly and made into a better crop for making flour, bread and other things. The mill at Tring which is called Heygates takes most of the seed to make flour and bread. One of the dairy farms is called B and M dairies. The other one is not actually a dairy farm but it still has cows and a milking parlour. Some of the farms only grow crops: wheat, barley, and grass for hay or silage.
.
